doc.field: Series I. Appeal of Conscience Foundation Material
Series I. Appeal of Conscience Foundation Material

This series contains material collected and created by ACF from 1964 to 2018. This series includes programs, slides, travel documents, itineraries, agendas, schedules, speech transcripts, correspondence, photographs, press, images, audio and video recordings, and ephemera from ACF related events, meetings, and trips. The bulk of the material consists of correspondence created by ACF to inform their donor base about events and activities co-sponsored and created by the Foundation. Included in ACF correspondence are the Foundation's newsletter and correspondence with internationally renowned political and religious dignitaries. Also present in this series are an annual seminar that the Foundation runs for the United States Department of State, and an annual awards dinner and luncheon that serves as the major fundraiser for the Foundation. Since its inception, ACF has hosted many religious and political dignitaries domestically and has also sent many interfaith delegations abroad to promote religious tolerance. This series contains audio recordings, speeches, photographs, press, agendas, schedules, travel documents, and correspondence from all activities related to those types of trips and meetings. There is a small amount of material in this series documenting ACF delegations visiting the Soviet Union to advocate for Soviet Jews throughout the 1970s. There are some brochures, audio recordings, agendas, folders, notes, copies of resolutions, correspondence, and press related material from the international Peace and Tolerance Conferences that ACF co-sponsored and co-ran with the Orthodox Patriarche from 1992-2005.
